result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:18 PM Defendant Anthony Troth Price Jr appears via zoom, Atty Adam P Nero appears via zoom, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Using DAR for backup. Includes 22CF3 (ARGN) and 22TR44 (STC).  Information filed with the Court. Court reviews charges with DE. Court reviews DE's rights. NG to all Counts. Atty Nero is requesting a zoom STC within 60 days, DA Hatch is in agreement. Court confirms address and phone number. 22TR44 to follow. Court adjourned at 1:23 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: of Judge filed by Atty Nero
Arraignment on May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:04 PM  Defendant Anthony Troth Price Jr in Court with Attorney Adam P Nero.  DA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms receipt of Information.  Court advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Atty. Nero requests to hold off on Arraignment for him to discuss possible substitution.  Bond continues.  Adjourned at 1:09 PM

01:00 PM Defendant Anthony Troth Price Jr in Court with Attorney Adam P Nero.  DA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Set for Preliminary Hearing on 22CT3, Status on 22TR44.  Before going on the record, Officer Darren Ekholm present, Court excuses.  Atty. Nero advises of waiver.  Court advises Defendant of rights, he understands.  Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for further proceedings.  Arraignment scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY
NO POSSESSION OF ALCOHOL
NO ENTRY INTO BARS, TAVERNS, LIQUOR STORES OR ANY LOCATION WHERE THE ALCOHOL IS THE PRIMARY SALES/SERVICE.

03:34 PM Defendant Anthony Troth Price Jr appears via videoconferencing from PCJ with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson via phone.  Defendant Anthony Troth Price Jr in custody.  DA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises Defendant of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  State requests $25,0000 signature bond w/conditions of AS, NPOA, NEBTLS.  No objection.  Court orders bond as requested and advises of additional standard conditions.  Court questions Defendant's address, phone, dob.  Non-military.  Court advises Defendant of right to speedy preliminary hearing, Defendant waives.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives right to a speedy preliminary hearing.  PD will not be involved.  Adjourned at 3:44 PM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
